channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Amid fraud claims, Trump admin announces more changes to federal child care funding
item.description: The Child Care and Development Fund sends money to states to help make child care more affordable for low-income families. Allegations of fraud in Minnesota have put the program under scrutiny.
item.content:encoded:
The Child Care and Development Fund sends money to states to help make child care more affordable for low-income families. Allegations of fraud in Minnesota have put the program under scrutiny.

(Image credit: Renee Jones Schneider)
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: She experienced homelessness. Now she's helping people who don't have homes stay warm
item.description: Each year, Reno, Nev., has several months of below-freezing temperatures. A longtime advocate for homeless people in the city has established a warming center that offers a safe place to stay.
item.content:encoded: Each year, Reno, Nev., has several months of below-freezing temperatures. A longtime advocate for homeless people in the city has established a warming center that offers a safe place to stay.
item.dc:creator: Fil Corbitt

item.title: These California students found lessons of hope in the aftermath of the Palisades Fire
item.description: One year after the Los Angeles wildfires, a group of California elementary schoolers document the impact — including the hope, kindness and community that rose from the ashes.
item.content:encoded: One year after the Los Angeles wildfires, a group of California elementary schoolers document the impact — including the hope, kindness and community that rose from the ashes.
item.dc:creator: Janet W. Lee

item.title: 'Everything I knew burned down around me': A journalist looks back on LA's fires
item.description: Jacob Soboroff was raised in the Pacific Palisades and reported live from the area as it was devastated by fire in 2025. In Firestorm, Soboroff offers a minute-by-minute account of the catastrophe.
item.content:encoded:
Jacob Soboroff was raised in the Pacific Palisades and reported live from the area as it was devastated by fire in 2025. In Firestorm, Soboroff offers a minute-by-minute account of the catastrophe.

(Image credit: Josh Edelson)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: The NYC jail holding Maduro has a history of big names and dangerous conditions
item.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is being held in the troubled New York City jail that has housed high-profile defendants like Sean "Diddy" Combs, Ghislaine Maxwell and Honduras' former president.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is being held in the troubled New York City jail that has housed high-profile defendants like Sean "Diddy" Combs, Ghislaine Maxwell and Honduras' former president.

(Image credit: John Lamparksi)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Maduro and wife plead not guilty to narco-terrorism charges
item.description: Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores have pleaded not guilty to all charges during their first court appearance in their federal narco-terrorism case.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores have pleaded not guilty to all charges during their first court appearance in their federal narco-terrorism case.

(Image credit: José A. Alvarado Jr. for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Sen. Mark Kelly fires back after Hegseth threatens his rank and retirement pay
item.description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth has launched administrative action against Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly, a retired Navy captain and astronaut, which could affect Kelly's rank and retirement pay.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth has launched administrative action against Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly, a retired Navy captain and astronaut, which could affect Kelly's rank and retirement pay.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: New coins marking nation's 250th birthday begin circulating Monday
item.description: The U.S. Mint is releasing commemorative coins to celebrate the nation's 250th anniversary. But there is controversy over the coin designs the Trump administration chose not to released.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Mint is releasing commemorative coins to celebrate the nation's 250th anniversary. But there is controversy over the coin designs the Trump administration chose not to released.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: 2 police officers relive Jan. 6 through their own bodycam footage
item.description: D.C. police officers experienced some of the most intense violence during the attack on the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021. We sat down with two of them to rewatch their body camera footage from that day.
item.content:encoded: D.C. police officers experienced some of the most intense violence during the attack on the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021. We sat down with two of them to rewatch their body camera footage from that day.
item.dc:creator: Bronson Arcuri

item.title: NPR's archive preserves the facts of the Jan. 6 Capitol riot
item.description: As the Trump administration tries to rewrite the history of the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol, a new NPR investigative project is preserving evidence of the crimes committed that day.
item.content:encoded: As the Trump administration tries to rewrite the history of the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol, a new NPR investigative project is preserving evidence of the crimes committed that day.
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach
